member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName
member.summary: Contains names for common resource qualifiers such as language, system theme, and display scale.

member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the contrast settings.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the contrast settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.Custom
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on a custom value.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based a custom value.

member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current device's family.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current device's family.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.HomeRegion
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current home region.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current home region.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.Language
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current language.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.LayoutDirection
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current UI layout direction.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current UI layout direction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.Scale
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current display scale.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current display scale.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.TargetSize
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on target size.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on target size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.KnownResourceQualifierName.Theme
member.summary: Gets the name for a qualifier based on the current theme.
member.returns: The name for a qualifier based on the current theme.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate
member.summary: Represents a single possible value for a given resource, the qualifiers associated with that resource, and how well those qualifiers match the context against which it was resolved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.#ctor(Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ResourceCandidate class with the specified value.
member.param: The type of ResourceCandidate being created.
The value of the ResourceCandidate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ResourceCandidate class with the specified value.
member.param: The value for this ResourceCandidate represented as a bytes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.Kind
member.summary: Gets the type of resource that is encapsulated in this ResourceCandidate.
member.returns: A ResourceCandidateKind that specifies the type of resource that is encapsulated in this ResourceCandidate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.QualifierValues
member.summary: Gets the qualifiers associated with this ResourceCandidate.
member.returns: A dictionary that contains all qualifiers associated with this ResourceCandidate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.ValueAsBytes
member.summary: Gets the value of the ResourceCandidate represented in bytes.
member.returns: The value of the ResourceCandidate represented in bytes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate.ValueAsString
member.summary: Gets the value of the ResourceCandidate represented as a string.
member.returns: The value of the ResourceCandidate represented as a string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind
member.summary: Defines values that represent the type of resource that is encapsulated in a ResourceCandidate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind.EmbeddedData
member.summary: The resource is embedded data in some containing resource file (such as a .resw file).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind.FilePath
member.summary: The resource is a file located at the specified location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind.String
member.summary: The resource is a string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidateKind.Unknown
member.summary: The ResourceCandidate is of an unknown type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceContext
member.summary: Encapsulates all of the factors that might affect resource selection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceContext.QualifierValues
member.summary: Gets a map of all supported qualifiers, indexed by name.
member.returns:
The map of qualifiers, which you use to map a qualifier name to a qualifier value. The qualifier value returned represents the current setting. Here is a reference table of all the possible qualifier values that can be returned. See Tailor your resources for language, scale, high contrast, and other qualifiers for an explanation of the general concept of qualifiers, how to use them, and the purpose of each of the qualifier names.
| Qualifier name | Qualifier values | |-------------------------------|------------------| | alternateform, or altform | A string, between 1 and 16 chars in length, representing an alternate form of a resource. | | configuration, or configA | string. Matches the value of the MS_CONFIGURATION_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE environment variable. It's unlikely that you'll need to use this qualifier name (see the Configuration section of Tailor your resources for language, scale, high contrast, and other qualifiers). | | contrast | Either standard (the default; matches high contrast off), high (matches any high contrast setting), black (matches High Contrast Black, High Contrast #1, and High Contrast #2), or white (matches High Contrast White). | | custom | A custom value. | | devicefamily | It's unlikely that you'll need to use this qualifier name (see the DeviceFamily section of Tailor your resources for language, scale, high contrast, and other qualifiers). | | dxfeaturelevel, or dxfl | Either DX9, DX10, DX11, or DX12. This qualifier has been deprecated. See the DXFeatureLevel section of Tailor your resources for language, scale, high contrast, and other qualifiers. | | homeregion | Any valid BCP-47 region tag (such as us, or 840). That is, any ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two-letter region code, plus the set of ISO 3166-1 numeric three-digit geographic codes for composed regions (see United Nations Statistic Division M49 composition of region codes). Matches the country or region setting. | | language, or lang | Any valid BCP-47 language tag (such as en, or en-US). Matches the display language setting. For a list of languages, see the IANA language subtag registry. | | layoutdirection, or layoutdir | Either LTR (left-to-right), RTL (right-to-left), TTBLTR (top-to-bottom, left-to-right), or TTBRTL (top-to-bottom, right-to-left). Matches the layout direction of the display language setting. | | scale | Either 80, 100 (default), 120, 125, 140, 150, 160, 175, 180, 200, 225, 250, 300, 350, 400, or 450. Matches the display scale setting. The values 125, 150, 175, 225, 250, 300, 350, 400, and 450 were introduced in Windows 10. | | targetsize | A positive integer that represents the side length of a square image in raw (physical) pixels. Matches the View setting in File Explorer. | | theme | Either dark or light. Matches the default or overridden app mode setting.|

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader
member.summary: Provides simplified access to app resources such as app UI strings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new ResourceLoader object for the "Resources" subtree of the currently running app's main ResourceMap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new ResourceLoader object for the specified ResourceMap.
member.param:
The resource identifier of the ResourceMap that the new resource loader uses for unqualified resource references. It can then retrieve resources relative to those references.
> [!NOTE] > The resource identifier is treated as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) fragment, subject to Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) semantics. For example, "Caption%20" is treated as "Caption ". Do not use "?" or "#" in resource identifiers, as they terminate the resource path. For example, "Foo?3" is treated as "Foo".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ResourceLoader for the given context and map.
member.param: The path and name of the file that should be used for the current context.
The resource identifier of the resourceMap used for unqualified resource references by the new ResourceLoader. The ResourceLoader can then retrieve resources relative to those references.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.GetDefaultResourceFilePath
member.summary: Gets the default resource file path, which is the path a ResourceLoader will be created with if no custom path is specified.
member.returns: The default path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.GetString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the most appropriate string value of a resource, specified by resource identifier.
member.param:
The resource identifier of the resource to be resolved.
> [!NOTE] > The resource identifier is treated as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) fragment, subject to Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) semantics. For example, getString ("Caption%20") is treated as getString ("Caption "). Do not use "?" or "#" in resource identifiers, as they terminate the resource path. For example, "Foo?3" is treated as "Foo".
member.returns: The most appropriate string value of the specified resource for the default ResourceContext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader.GetStringForUri(Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Returns the most appropriate string value of a resource, specified by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resource identifier, for the default ResourceContext of the currently running app.
member.param: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that represents the resource to be retrieved.
member.returns: The most appropriate string value of the specified resource for the default ResourceContext.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Provides access to app resource maps and more advanced resource functionality.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager.ResourceNotFound
member.summary: Event that fires when an attempt to get a resource fails because the specified resource was not found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a ResourceManager object using the default settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ResourceManager object.
member.param: The resource file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager.CreateResourceContext
member.summary: Creates a ResourceContext with the default settings.
member.returns: A ResourceContext.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceManager.MainResourceMap
member.summary: Gets the ResourceMap that is associated with the main package of the currently running app.
member.returns: The ResourceMap.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap
member.summary: A collection of related resources, typically either for a particular app package, or a resource file for a particular package.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.GetSubtree(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a ResourceMap that represents a part of another ResourceMap, typically used to access a particular resource file within an app package.
This method finds subtree, ancestor, sibling and cousin maps to this resource map, as well as top-level maps. It returns the resource map represented by a given resource map identifier, relative to this resource map. This method is typically used to make simpler references to a particular subset of resources, such as a single resource file, or a directory of files.
member.param: A resource map identifier that identifies the root of the new subtree. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
member.returns: The subtree ResourceMap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the most appropriate candidate for a resource that is specified by a resource identifier within the default context.
member.param: A resource identifier specified as a name or reference. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
member.returns: A ResourceCandidate that describes the most appropriate candidate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.GetValue(System.String,Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceContext)
member.summary: Returns the most appropriate candidate for a resource that is specified by a resource identifier for the supplied context.
member.param: A resource specified as a name or reference. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
The context for which to select the most appropriate candidate.
member.returns: A ResourceCandidate that describes the most appropriate candidate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.GetValueByIndex(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the resource at the specified index in the default context.
member.param: The index to use to locate the resource in the context.
member.returns: The value, if an item with the specified index exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.GetValueByIndex(System.UInt32,Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceContext)
member.summary: Returns the resource at the specified index in the specified context.
member.param: The index to use to locate the resource in the context.
member.returns: The value, if an item with the specified index exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.TryGetSubtree(System.String)
member.summary:
Tries to find a ResourceMap that represents a part of another ResourceMap, typically used to access a particular resource file within an app package.
This method finds subtree, ancestor, sibling and cousin maps to this resource map, as well as top-level maps. It returns the resource map represented by a given resource map identifier, relative to this resource map. This method is typically used to make simpler references to a particular subset of resources, such as a single resource file, or a directory of files.
member.param: A resource map identifier that identifies the root of the new subtree. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
member.returns: The subtree ResourceMap. If the specified resource map identifier is not found, this method returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.TryGetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to find the most appropriate candidate for a resource that is specified by a resource identifier within the default context.
member.param: A resource identifier specified as a name or reference. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
member.returns: A ResourceCandidate that describes the most appropriate candidate. If the specified resource identifier is not found, this method returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.TryGetValue(System.String,Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceContext)
member.summary: Tries to find the most appropriate candidate for a resource that is specified by a resource identifier for the supplied context.
member.param: A resource specified as a name or reference. For details, see the remarks for ResourceMap class.
The context for which to select the most appropriate candidate.
member.returns: A ResourceCandidate that describes the most appropriate candidate. If the specified resource identifier is not found, this method returns null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceMap.ResourceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of resources in the ResourceMap.
member.returns: The number of resources contained in the map.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceNotFoundEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about a failed attempt to retrieve a resource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceNotFoundEventArgs.SetResolvedCandidate(Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceCandidate)
member.summary: Specify a ResourceCandidate to be used when the requested candidate is not found.
member.param: The ResourceCandidate to be used instead of the requested candidate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceNotFoundEventArgs.Context
member.summary: Gets the ResourceContext in which the resource was not found.
member.returns: The ResourceContext in which the resource was not found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceNotFoundEventArgs.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the resource that was not found.
member.returns: The name of the resource that was not found.
